column2: Typhoon!

Messengers report that a massive typhoon has made landfall several days ago near [From.County.GetName], devastating much of the nearby coastline! It will be months before everything is back to normal.
My lands are unaffected.
Typhoon!
A typhoon has struck your county of [Root.GetName]!
Characters in this county must fend for themselves\n\n
Characters in this county are well protected\n\n
Typhoon Damage
High winds and flooding have damaged many buildings in this county.
Flooded Farmland
Floods have wiped out much of the harvest for this year.
Ruined Roads
Roads and bridges in this county have been badly damaged by a recent storm.
Damaged Trade Post
The merchant docks and warehouses have been damaged and looted.
Protector in the Storm
You responded well when a typhoon struck, and kept everyone safe.
Opportunist
You were noticed taking advantage of a disaster.
Recent Holy War
Gain the Recent Holy War modifier.\n
I think I can keep everybody safe.
Keep the roads clear, protect those close to me.
Focus on aiding the common folk.
Have your men plunder under cover of the storm.
No need to worry, let the storm come!
The sky grows black over the ocean as a massive storm approaches. The wind blows at gale force. Torrential rains flood the streets and fields.\n\n[This.Location.GetName] is a dangerous place to be!
Typhoon strikes [This.Location.GetName]
I might not be up to the challenge.
I'll try to stay alive.
Fortunately I have the ability to protect myself.

The sky grows black over the ocean as a massive storm approaches. The wind blows at gale force. Torrential rains flood the streets and fields.\n\nFortunately, you are well protected in [This.Location.GetName].
I'll be fine.
Do my part to aid those in need.
May [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] protect those out in the storm.
Prey on the unprepared.
After a disaster, there are often unscrupulous men who wish to take advantage of the chaos. With damage from recent events, bandits are beginning to appear in [Root.GetName].
Nothing can be done.
Put a bounty on them.
Kill the leaders, put their heads on pikes.
The Big One!

A massive earthquake has struck [From.GetName]! The ground shifts and shakes, threatening to reduce every castle and cottage to a pile of smouldering rubble. Minor tremors are fairly common in [From.GetName], but an earth-shifting convulsion this powerful occurs only once in a generation.\n\nThe debris-strewn streets are full of corpses pinned beneath broken masonry. The moaning wounded stagger among the wreckage, attempting to rescue their kin. A bloody madman is screaming that the end is near, that we'll see Armageddon soon.
Structures in [From.GetName] are built to withstand this.
This option is available because local laws require sturdy building construction.\n
The fortifications must be repaired.
Focus on fire-fighting efforts in the cities.
The common folk of [From.GetName] come first.
Run, [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] must be angry!

An earthquake has struck [From.GetName]! The ground rumbles and shakes, threatening to damage poorly constructed buildings. Stained-glass windows crack, loose objects are scattered across the floor, and livestock are spooked by the motion of the Earth.\n\nWell, it could have been worse...

An aftershock has struck [From.GetName]! Once again the ground rumbles and shakes, further damaging poorly constructed buildings. The wrath of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] is disrupting the repair work!\n\nWhen will this end?

Fires in [This.GetName] are out of control! In the chaotic aftermath of the earthquake, broken lanterns and embers scattered from cooking fires started numerous small fires in the most densely populated areas. Important buildings are at risk of being completely destroyed!
Hire a huge bucket brigade!
Nothing can be done.
Earthquake Damage
An earthquake has dealt widespread damage to buildings and roads in this province.
Collapsed Fortifications
An earthquake has collapsed castle walls and other fortifications in this province.
Fire Damage
Fire has damaged fields and wooden buildings in this province.
Building Code
Strict building codes make structures in this province more resistant to damage from earthquakes.
Survived the Big One
This character bore personal witness to a once-in-a-generation earthquake... and survived.

Your subjects in [From.GetName] are calling for you to do something to protect them from future earthquakes. Codifying construction methods that produce sturdier buildings seems like a good first step.
Building codes for the whole realm.
Building codes for my demesne.
Building codes for [From.GetName].
I don't need no stinkin' codes.
The Ground Shakes!

The Big One arrives in [FromFrom.GetName] with a distant rumble that rattles loose objects from tables. The quake quickly escalates into a roar as the Earth gallops under your feet, throwing you to the ground and filling the air with dust and debris. You feel a bitter rush of adrenaline, knowing that this moment could be your last...
The Earth in [FromFrom.GetName] quakes beneath your feet, scattering loose objects across the floor. You brace yourself against a sturdy wall and attempt to ride out the tremor.

Guilds of masons and carpenters in [Root.GetName] are petitioning for you to repeal the current building codes. The codes were put into place in the aftermath of an earthquake, but the guild representative claims the codes are onerous and costly.
Perhaps a few coins could change my mind...
Yes, these codes are antiquated.
No, safety of my people comes first.
Reproach the Chinese Church

The Christian Patriotic Association, or Aiguo, has often been in direct opposition to the authority of the Catholic Church though it appears times are changing as members of the Chinese delegation are willing to hear reason as their great Emperor has decided to embrace the authority of the Vicar of St. Peter's flocks.
The §YChinese Delegation§! is NOT §YAiguo§! or a heresy\n
Holder is §YCatholic§!, §YRestorationist§!, or §YRizalista§! and NOT a heretic\n
The Patriotic Association stands with the Catholic Church!
The Aiguo Reproachment

At last the authority of the Catholic Church has been restored over the Middle Kingdom. With the spread of Catholicism and the submission of the Son of Heaven, including the clergy of the Patriotic Association, the former powers that once oppressed the church now holds little sway over the people of China. There will be those who still cling to it, but they will be few in number and no longer challenge the Church's Authority.
If that's the way the wind is blowing...
column3: Si c'est ainsi que le vent souffle...
column6: Si esto es la dirección que el viento está soplando ...

column2: Controls the Duchy and County of Beijing
zombie
nice
scary
godlike
weak
smart
shrewd
noble
tricky
nerd
dork
two-faced
president
presidential
mean
blessed
lucky
ineffectual
inquisitive
false Cetic
sage
radiant
decorated
chivalrous
knight
false knight
knight in heels
hiker
Paradise Knight

The life of Animist warriors is one of constant battle, and the Animist Knights are the bravest and most fearsome. Their primary purpose is to defend the animas of all living things and preserve the unending paradise.
column3: La vie des guerriers aztèques est faite de batailles, et les guerriers aigles sont les plus braves et les plus redoutés. Leur but premier est de capturer des prisonniers qui seront sacrifiés aux dieux.
column4: Das Leben eines aztekischen Kriegers besteht aus ständigem Kampf, und die Adlerritter sind die tapfersten und furchterregendsten. Ihr Hauptzweck besteht darin, die Gefangenen zu fassen, die ihren Göttern geopfert werden sollen.
column6: La vida de los guerreros aztecas es de batallas constantes, y los Caballeros del águila son los más valientes y temibles. Su mayor propósito es capturar prisioneros para ofrecerlos en sacrificio a sus dioses.

column2: A locally raised counciller has arrived to your court bowing respectfully claiming to be selected from the local village to be part of magnificent court. You respectfully recieve this new member of the court.

A locally raised magistrate has arrived to your court bowing respectfully claiming to be selected from the local council to be part of the state bureaucracy. You respectfully recieve this new member of the court.
A minor clan has arrived to your court bowing respectfully claiming to be selected from the local prefect to be part of your sublime court. You respectfully recieve this new member of the court.
Improper Priest
The personality and habits of this Mormon priest are very inappropriate for [GetHerHis] position. And what's worse, [GetSheHe] has been unable to hide them from public view.
Publicly follows the §Y[nousthreskeia.GetName]§! religion
Old World Shades
Tinted glasses from the ancient world, clearer than anything modern craftsmen can produce. Although they do not correct a person's vision, they can effectively shield one's eyes from harsh light.
Old World Firearm
A lovingly restored and functional pre-calamity firearm.
Old World Calculator
A functional pre-calamity mechanical calculating device.
Old World Timekeeper
A polished and ticking pre-calamity clockwork timekeeper.
Old World Typewriter
A carefully maintained pre-calamity mechanical lettering device.
Old World Far-Seer
A restored and functional pre-calamity portable telescope.
Old World Books
A small collection of intact pre-calamity academic books.
Old World Compass
A restored and functional pre-calamity magnetic compass.
Old World Glass
Glassware from the ancient world, finer than anything modern glassblowers can produce.
Old World Jewelry
Jewelry from the ancient world, more intricate than anything modern artisans can produce.
Old World Money
Old Paper Money from the early Hong Dynasty.
Old World Music Box
An ancient, shiny device that contains the melodies of the Old World.
Old World Machinery
A fabulously preserved piece of Old World machinery, constructed of a miraculous metal and blessed so that it shall never rust.
Famous Ancient Firearm
Once it spat fire and lead on enemies of your kin. \nNow it is merely a reminder of what was lost.
Salvage Expedition
The salvagers need a constant supply of salvaged Old World technology to continue their studies, and a lucky salvager might find himself wielding a powerful tech prize.
Salvage Expedition

The people of the Old World left many amazing artifacts behind. Powerful weapons, tools that aid in all varieties of work, machinery our most brilliant Salvagers do not fully understand, and beautiful objects our finest artisans cannot replicate. Much of the Old World is gone, consumed by centuries of rust, but a few rare artifacts survive in workable condition...\n\nAcquiring such an artifact will not only bring me wealth and prestige, it is the sacred duty of all followers of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName].
Hmmm, where will I find good salvage?

You check the maps, and have located several potential expedition sites in the province of [From.GetName]. The people of [From.GetName] follow the [From.Religion.GetName] faith, and are culturally [From.Culture.GetName].\n\nProvinces populated by infidels are more likely to contain items of the Old World, since they do not have the traditions of salvage.
That will be my destination.
That province is unacceptable.
Before leaving on your Salvage Expedition to [From.GetName], it would be wise to make preparations.
Set out with your men.
Consult the Salvagers for good salvage locations.
Assemble a battle-hardened warband to accompany you.
Send envoys ahead to smooth your travels.
Unfriendly Locals

You arrive in [From.GetName], and many of the local residents are distrustful or outright hostile towards you and your men. You notice them watching you surreptitiously and talking amongst themselves, and have a difficult time finding a place to rest.
Ignore them.
We're well armed, they won't risk attacking us.
My envoys have arranged for safe passage.
Try to keep a low profile.

Rust Cultists from a nearby realm are attempting to salvage Old World artifacts from your lands in [Root.GetName]. Their presence seems to be drawing the ire of the local [Root.Religion.GetName] population, who are preparing for a confrontation with them.
Let the locals drive them away.
We must avoid bloodshed.

Mixed among the local residents in [From.GetName], you see the occasional soldier wearing the colors of [From.Holder.GetTitledFirstName]. Fortunately, the soldiers seem to be ensuring that order is maintained and the locals allow you to pass without conflict.
Hostile Locals

Your continued presence in [From.GetName] has drawn the ire of the local peasantry, and you are now confronted by a disorganized mob of angry villagers. They may not be well armed, and they're certainly not well trained...\n\n...but there are a lot of them.
We should turn back.
Your Salvage Expedition is over.
Your Salvage Expedition continues.
We can fight our way through!
They'll back down from a vulgar display of power!
Peasants like silver, right?
Driven from [From.From.GetName]
Hordes of angry local villagers have driven you from their lands, ending your Salvage Expedition. If it makes you feel better, tell yourself you left to avoid shedding THEIR blood.
Competing Salvager
During your expedition to [From.GetName], you encounter an agent of an unknown lord who shares your faith. He appears to be scouting new salvage sites for his master, in direct competition with you!
May the best salvager win!
Direct him to a promising site nearby.
Make him disappear.
Collapse!

You hoped the wooden reinforcement beams would be enough, but one of them slipped. The centuries have not been kind to the crumbling concrete and rusty iron, and the whole unstable mess is coming down around you!
Run for it!
I won't let debris stand in my way!
I planned for this risk.
Recent Salvage
This character has recently gone on a Salvage Expedition.
Preparing Expedition
This character is preparing to go on a Salvage Expedition.
Salvage in [From.GetName]
Your expedition has turned up very little valuable salvage. You have explored many ruined buildings, and everywhere you look you find the ruins picked clean.
Disappointing.
Someone has been here before me...
There is another site nearby we could check.

Your expedition has turned up a few items of useful salvage. In the ruined buildings and tunnels you have uncovered several artifacts of the Old World, though you have not yet found the kind of major prize you were hoping for.
At least I found something.
Hawk these trinkets, I know of another site.

Your men have discovered a large metal box beneath the ruins of a long-forgotten structure in [From.GetName]. The strongbox is corroded but still intact. Who knows what mysteries or treasures of the Old World are sealed within it?
I'll know soon, crack it open!
Have your tinker open it carefully.
Salvage

You have found scraps of Old World artifacts, but none of them are especially well preserved. There are objects that may have once been used for cooking or as craftsmen's tools, but it's hard to tell with the corrosion and decay of the centuries. They might be worth a few gold pieces to the right buyer.

Your men have discovered a cache of corroded coins from the Old World. Their coins were inexplicably made out of base metals rather than gold or silver, dramatically reducing their value as working currency. Still, they might be worth a few gold pieces.

You have discovered a long-hidden supply of Old World glassware. Unlike iron objects which have mostly been consumed by rust, many glass objects have survived. You need but wipe off the centuries and you'll have finely polished Old World artifacts that artisans today cannot replicate.

Amongst a wreck of disintegrated iron, you find a fabulously preserved piece of Old World machinery. Though stained with rust, the beautiful object itself does not seem to have rusted. It is about three feet across, irregularly shaped, with a half-dozen holes perfectly cut partway through it. It is constructed from a metal that is lighter than iron.\n\nThis will be a great addition to your great hall, or part of a shrine.

You have found a long-abandoned pair of old-world glasses. Although they at first appear to be coated in dust, further inspection reveals that the glasses are tinted. Although the frame is somewhat rusted, the lenses themselves are in good condition. With some work, they could be used to create fully-functional and stylish shades.

Your men take to the box with hammers, and succeed in ripping the door off after a few hours. Whether it was the rough handling of the box, the ravages of time and moisture, or simple bad luck, you find nothing of value within.
Treasures!

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: a variety of Old World jewelery, glittering with gold, silver, and precious stones. The craftsmanship is finer and more intricate than what modern goldsmiths can produce.
Papers?

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: several old folios bound with crumbling dark leather and stacks of identical green paper strips with the rune "20" in the corners. It's amazing how well the safe has preserved its contents, the seal must have been perfect. The folios are filled with line after line of numbers and symbols.\n\nYou would be rich, if paper currency were still in use.
Ancient portraits of the Founders!
Icons of the Almighty Dollar!
Paintings?

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: a collection of dozens of tiny paintings, discolored with age but extremely detailed. The paintings depict a family of people in the Old World. How these paintings were produced is a mystery to you, as the canvas is very thin and there are no visible brush strokes.\n\nThe cracked and crumbling condition of the paintings makes you think they are unlikely to last long after being removed from the sealed safe.

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: a collection of small ornate boxes about the size of your palm. Each box contains a cylinder with patterns of tiny protrusions, adjacent to an array of metal tines of various lengths. You twist the small crank on the side of a box, it begins to plink out an Old World melody that probably hasn't been heard for centuries.\n\nThis will be a hit among my courtiers... a song for the ages!
Machinery!

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: a complicated piece of Old World technology, the purpose of which is a mystery to you. The artifact features several prominent finely blown glass bubbles, mechanical innards, and thin flexible metal strands that shed greenish-black powder when disturbed.\n\nYou are unable to get the artifact to do anything. There seems to be something missing that you don't understand.
Firepower!

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: a long metal tube with various bits of metal and brittle wood attached to it. You've heard stories that Old World knights used such devices to produce fire from nothing, but it's hard to believe you're seeing one for yourself.\n\nThough the safe has preserved it well, you will have to handle it gently and be unable to fix it if it breaks.

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: a well preserved piece of Old World technology with the word "Underwood" written on it in gleaming gold-leaf letters. Rows of thumbnail-sized metal disks are attached to the complicated mechanical innards of the machine, each labeled with a unique rune.\n\nAside from its beauty as a piece of recovered tech, this machine would probably be very useful if you could figure out how to use and maintain it...

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: a well preserved piece of Old World technology with the word "Arithmometer" engraved in the metal in a flowing script. The machine is dominated by a heavy horizontal metal cylinder, with numerals visible through gaps in the metal shell and a hefty metal hand-crank on the side.\n\nAside from its beauty as a piece of tech art, this machine would probably be very useful if you could figure out how to use and maintain it...

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: a golden, palm-sized clamshell disk, attached to an intricate chain of gold. When you open the clamshell you see that one side is labelled with the numerals I through XII, and you realize that the artifact is an Old World timekeeping device.\n\nIt would be a stylish accessory for any lord, but it would be even more useful if you could understand its workings and restore its function.

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: a segmented set of brass tubes with several curved internal mirrors and smoothly bulging disks of polished glass. The tools and knowledge to craft such a device have been lost, but you recognize it as an Old World version of today's spyglass.\n\nYou will be able to see things from a great distance.

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: several stacks of thick books. They have been sealed away from the ravages of the weather, but the centuries have still taken their toll on their brittle brown pages.\n\nWith luck, a scholar fluent in Old World languages will be able to extract useful information from the books before they crumble into dust.

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: a small metal disc with a string attached to it. As you hold the item, you notice that there is a free-floating needle inside. You realize that the artifact is a hand-held Old World navigational device.\n\nOnce you learn how to properly calibrate and use it, it is unlikely that you will ever lose your way again.
Salvage Expedition ends

Not all Salvage Expeditions end in success. Sometimes the recovered artifacts are badly damaged, sometimes they are worthless, sometimes there isn't anything to salvage because the area has been picked clean, and sometimes dangerous circumstances interrupt the expedition.\n\nThis is one of those times.
Until next time.

You have returned from your Salvage Expedition with baubles and artifacts of the Old World. Although you did not find a tech prize truly worthy of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]'s favor, at least you didn't return empty handed.
I'll keep the salvage for myself.
Someone will buy these trinkets.
I will donate these artifacts to the salvagers for study.

You have returned from your Salvage Expedition with an exciting tech prize, worthy of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]'s favor. Your court is buzzing with word of your success, and the salvagers are already coming to you with requests to examine your prize. It remains to be seen whether you can return the artifact to a functional state.\n\nThis will surely bring you fame, power, and understanding of the old world.
I must study and repair my prize.
The Past Restored

After weeks of study, your armorers have finally restored your Old World firearm to working condition! Much of the wood body had to be replaced, but the metal parts were functional. The charges required to operate the weapon are in extremely short supply, as many of those found alongside the weapon were dangerously unstable and your armorers do not yet know how to construct additional charges.\n\nYou will be a fearsome and inspiring figure on the battlefield!
This is my boomstick!

After weeks of study, your tinkers have finally restored your numeric calculating machine to working condition! You are still learning how to operate it: you enter numerals by sliding the levers into the correct positions, then turn the heavy crank and the machine produces the result of addition in mere seconds.\n\nThis will make it much easier to keep track of the rents and taxes that are owed to you!

After weeks of study, your tinkers have finally restored your gilded timekeeping device to working condition! Once the device is activated by inserting a key and twisting it, it begins to emit a soft ticking sound and the slender arms move smoothly across its face. You must handle the artifact carefully, because many of its small parts are irreplaceable.\n\nYou will be aided in any tasks that require precise measurement of time!

After weeks of study, your tinkers have finally restored your lettering machine to working condition! Their fingertips are black from handling powdered charcoal and other attempts at creating a useful ink. Study of the device has revealed much about the prowess of Old World smiths.\n\nYou are now able to issue decrees in the neat, authoritative letters of Underwood himself!

After weeks of study, your tinkers have finally restored your brass spyglass to working condition! Polishing with a soft cloth has brought the shine back to the metal, while the glass optics have retained their nearly perfect transparency. When you look through the eyepiece you are able to see things at a distance others could only dream about, even gazing at the Moon and stars as the people of the Old World must have.\n\nThe potential military advantages are enormous!

After weeks of study, your scholars have learned many things about your collection of pre-calamity books. Several of the books have fallen to pieces during transport or study, but those that survived are providing valuable insight into medicine, engineering, and other topics.\n\nMore study will reveal additional secrets of the old world!

After weeks of study, your tinkers have finally restored your compass to working condition! The needle inside the compass has been recalibrated, and the quicksilver inside has been refilled. You are still figuring out exactly how to orient yourself with it, but you feel as if you're getting better at it over time.\n\nThis will make it nearly impossible for you to get lost on long journeys.
I shall never lose my way again!
Unsolved Mysteries

Despite weeks of effort you have failed to restore your salvaged prize to a useful state. Your assistants don't possess the knowledge or the tools to help you accomplish this task, and your efforts only seem to be causing additional damage. Major portions of the prize are damaged or missing, and there may be some mystical component required to make the device function that is not available to you.
I can still display it as art.
Someone will buy it from me.
The real prize is the knowledge I've gained.
The salvagers will find a use for it.
Donated Tech Prizes
Tech Scavenger
This character is an accomplished scavenger of Old World technology.
Bequeathment
Your late [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] bequeathed an antique firearm to you. Hopefully it hasn't been damaged or lost in the confusion of [From.GetPossPronoun] passing.
Your late [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] bequeathed a pre-calamity antique typewriter to you. Hopefully it hasn't been damaged or lost in the confusion of [From.GetPossPronoun] passing.
Your late [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] bequeathed a pre-calamity mechanical calculator to you. Hopefully it hasn't been damaged or lost in the confusion of [From.GetPossPronoun] passing.
Your late [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] bequeathed a pre-calamity pocket watch to you. Hopefully it hasn't been damaged or lost in the confusion of [From.GetPossPronoun] passing.
Your late [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] bequeathed a pre-calamity brass telescope to you. Hopefully it hasn't been damaged or lost in the confusion of [From.GetPossPronoun] passing.

Your late [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] bequeathed a collection of pre-calamity textbooks to you. Hopefully they haven't been damaged or lost in the confusion of [From.GetPossPronoun] passing.
Grown-ups think you can't be trusted with it...
All these council meetings are confusing...
Now where did my [GetFromRelation] keep it?
I've been using it since I was young.
I've ensured I will retain possession of it.
The artifact is lost to the ages
Take Aim!

An arrow glances off your armor as the battle is joined, the air fills with a flurry of battle cries, and you hear the ringing sound of steel on steel.\n\nYour foes surge towards you, but you raise your Old World firearm to single out a looming warrior leading the charge. You pull the trigger and the warrior is felled with a deafening blast of light and smoke, his armor useless.
None dare to oppose the Firebringer!
Fools, I am the Thunderhand!
My marksmanship is perfect.
Run from me, cowards!
Storytelling

Sometimes you feel the urge to use your Old World typewriter to write things beyond the normal decrees, proclamations, and correspondence. Perhaps history will remember you more favorably if your thoughts on the events of the day are recorded in your own neatly machine-lettered words.
My dynasty will be remembered.
I'll tell a rousing story.
I will use it only for affairs of state.
Death and Taxes

It may be boring, but it is a crucial task for any [Root.GetTitle] to ensure that [Root.GetPossPronoun] expected tax revenue matches the rents paid by [Root.GetPossPronoun] vassals. Your Old World Arithmometer has made it much easier for you to do just that. You feel much more confident calculating the expected contents of your treasury, and can ensure that the numbers reported by your advisers are accurate.
This enhances my reputation for shrewdness.
I'm more machine than man!
Some of my vassals are short a few coins.
Precision in All Things

Since you acquired your Old World pocket watch, you feel like things have been running like... well, clockwork. You are able to bring precision and confidence to any issue you face. While others struggle with primitive sundials, you keep your stylish ticking companion with you at all times.
Plus, it goes with everything!
I make the carriages run on time.
Well, I am pretty great.
Watch the Skies

Sometimes you take your Old World telescope to a high tower late at night, and gaze through it at the sky. Some might consider it frivolous, but you find it relaxing to see the Moon and wandering stars in a way few have since the calamity.
I'll study the wandering stars, also known as planets.
My telescope should be reserved for scouting.
It's very calming.
Intense Study

You have been spending some time studying your collection of Old World books. You are not fully fluent in the language, but you have determined that one of the books is a manual of Old World treatments for human disease. Though some of the words are arcane and confusing, there are many useful anatomical diagrams and descriptions of healing techniques.
This will help me heal my wound.
This will help me cure my illness.
This will help me treat my sick children.
I have learned many things.
Reading is boring.
Finding a Way

Since you acquired your Old World compass, you have found that traveling has become much smoother. You almost never got lost, and you can safely find your way through paths that most would consider treacherous. You no longer have to struggle with crude maps or wait until nightfall to find your way.
It is much easier to move trade goods.
My troops will never get lost again!.
These paths are useful for avoiding enemies...
